page.title: 15 OUR JOURNEY TO SCHOOL
page.content: In the morning at twenty five past eight mummy takes us to the bottom of our half mile long drive where we wait for the minibus to take us to school. When there is a lot of ice or snow on the roads we do not go to school but mummy gives us lessons at home. When it is just cold mum takes us straight to school in the car because it is too cold to wait. We see lots of interesting things like rivers, big forests and cows grazing in the summer. In winter when it has been raining hard the river is brown and the forests are a brighter green. We are the fourth group on the bus and we get to school at 9 o'clock. There are 13 children and the bus is full. Most of us have a special seat but it is not a very comfortable ride because we are squashed.
